meta_title: CSV Cleaning Guides: Accents, Dates & Security | CleanMyCSV
meta_desc: Discover how CleanMyCSV fixes your files: accent correction (Ã©), zip code zero recovery, ISO date normalization, and anti-injection security.
hero_subtext: CleanMyCSV is not just a simple filter: it is an intelligent normalization engine that repairs structural errors in your data files to make them immediately actionable.
art1_p: The issue of unreadable characters (e.g., Ã© instead of é) stems from a conflict between Windows, Mac, and Web standards.
art1_feature: How does it work? Our engine analyzes your file on three levels: it first attempts UTF-8 decoding, then switches to Windows-1252 or MacRoman if errors are detected. This ensures perfect readability of your text, regardless of the source tool.
art2_p: A CSV file can use commas, semicolons, or tabs. Choosing the wrong separator when opening it can dump your entire table into a single column.
art2_feature: Automation: CleanMyCSV statistically calculates the most probable separator by analyzing the first 10,000 characters. Additionally, the tool automatically removes empty lines and perfect duplicates to lighten your database.
art3_p: Software like Salesforce or HubSpot often requires a strict date format (YYYY-MM-DD). However, human-created files often mix formats.
art3_feature: The Solution: Our algorithm unifies everything to the YYYY-MM-DD standard. It even handles months written in French/English (Jan, Feb, Dec...) and corrects the "pivot rule" for two-digit years (e.g., 24 becomes 2024).
art4_p: It is impossible to sum cells containing "150,00 €". For Excel, that is text, not a number.
art4_feature: Financial Intelligence: CleanMyCSV extracts the currency symbol ($, €, £, CAD...), places it in a dedicated new column called "Currency", and transforms the amount into a pure number (decimal point format).
art5_p: Cleaning emails and phone numbers is the tool's strong suit for marketing teams.
art5_li1: Emails: Removal of stray spaces and systematic conversion to lowercase.
art5_li2: Phones: Normalization to international format (e.g., +33 for France).
art5_li3: Zip Codes: Restoration of the initial 0 often deleted by Excel (e.g., 06100).
art5_li4: Names: Smart capitalization respecting particles (e.g., "Jean de la Fontaine").
art6_p: A CSV file can be a security vulnerability if it contains cells starting with =, +, or -. These characters can force Excel to execute malicious commands.
art6_feature: Native Shield: CleanMyCSV detects these suspicious formulas and neutralizes them by adding a security apostrophe ('). Your computer and corporate network remain protected.
art7_p: Unlike "black box" tools, we provide you with a detailed log (JSON format) of every modification made.
art7_feature: Traceability: This report allows you to verify exactly which cell was modified, what its original value was, and why it was corrected.
faq_title: FAQ: Answers to Your Technical Questions
faq_q1: What is the maximum file size accepted?
faq_a1: The tool accepts files up to 15 MB, which typically represents several hundred thousand rows.
faq_a2: No. Files are processed in the server's RAM and stored temporarily (15 minutes maximum) in a secure space before total deletion.
faq_a3: If the tool detects currency symbols in your amount column, it automatically creates this column so that your figures remain pure numbers usable by your Excel formulas.
